title: Former boxer Michael Watson and his carer hospitalised after shocking car attack - Mirror Online
text:

Former boxer Michael Watson and his carer Lennard Ballack were hospitalised on Friday night after an horrific attack. 
Boxing News say Watson, who suffered life-changing injuries in a fight against Chris Eubank Snr in 1991, and Ballack were travelling down a street in Chingford when their car was struck from behind by VW Golf. 
The assailants then got out of the Golf before approaching Watson and Ballack's vehicle. 
The pair's attackers are said to have sprayed a substance into Ballack's eyes before flooring Watson and dragging him down the street. 
It is thought that the assailants intended to steal the vehicle Watson and Ballack were travelling in but eventually fled empty handed. Watson suffered severe head injuries in a fight against Chris Eubank Snr in 1991 (Photo: Mirrorpix) 
Watson suffered burns to his skin as a result of the attack but he and Ballack were deemed well enough to be released from hospital on Saturday. 
Police are appealing for anybody with information about the incident to come forward. 
Watson suffered severe head injuries in a world title fight against Eubank Snr 26 years ago which left him disabled. Like us on Facebook
